properties.description:
Run a simple ETL job using Azure Databricks, with a single pane of glass monitoring from ADF.

In the template, we check for source dataset availability. Once it is available we copy it into a blob storage for staging using a Copy activity. The same storage is accessed from Databricks clusters while processing the data (ETL). The output is stored in the same storage under 'output' folder. Various notebook properties are referenced as expressions using pipeline parameters, which lets you configure more generic and reusable pipelines. 
 
For steps on setting up storage and databricks notebook refer https://aka.ms/databricks-instructions.

activities.name: Availability flag
activities.description:
Lookup (or Get Metadata) activity is used to get information about the source files if they are available for processing. 
In this template, only when the '_success' flag/ file is available at source, would the downstream activities be triggered.

activities.name: file-to-blob
activities.description: Copy activity copies the actual files/ dataset to be processed by Databricks into a staging store. This storage should be accessible by the Azure Databricks cluster referenced in the next activity.

activities.name: ETL
activities.description: Databricks Notebook activity does the processing of the data copied in the previous step (copy activity). Please ensure you have added the databricks notebook (https://adflabstaging1.blob.core.windows.net/share/Transformations.html) in the databricks work-space and referenced it in the notebook activity in ADF.

sources.name: sourceName
sources.script:
source(output(
		{Emp ID} as integer,
		{Name Prefix} as string,
		{First Name} as string,
		{Middle Initial} as string,
		{Last Name} as string,
		Gender as string,
		{E Mail} as string,
		{Father's Name} as string,
		{Mother's Name} as string,
		{Mother's Maiden Name} as string,
		{Date of Birth} as date,
		{Time of Birth} as string,
		{Age in Yrs.} as double,
		{Weight in Kgs.} as integer,
		{Date of Joining} as date,
		{Quarter of Joining} as string,
		{Half of Joining} as string,
		{Year of Joining} as short,
		{Month of Joining} as short,
		{Month Name of Joining} as string,
		{Short Month} as string,
		{Day of Joining} as short,
		{DOW of Joining} as string,
		{Short DOW} as string,
		{Age in Company (Years)} as double,
		Salary as integer,
		{Last % Hike} as string,
		SSN as string,
		{Phone No. } as string,
		{Place Name} as string,
		County as string,
		City as string,
		State as string,
		Zip as integer,
		Region as string,
		{User Name} as string,
		Password as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false) ~> sourceName

sinks.name: sinkDupes
sinks.script:
CheckForDupes@Duplicates sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	partitionFileNames:['dupes.csv']) ~> sinkDupes

sinks.name: sinkNoDupes
sinks.script:
CheckForDupes@NotDupe sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	partitionFileNames:['nodupes.csv']) ~> sinkNoDupes

transformations.name: Orig1
transformations.script:
FuzzyMatch select(mapColumn(
		acctnum,
		fullname,
		phone,
		zip,
		SoundexValue
	))~> Orig1

transformations.name: soundexJoin
transformations.script:
groupSoundex, soundexBranch join(groupSoundex@SoundexValue == soundexBranch@SoundexValue,
	joinType:'inner',
	broadcast: 'none')~> soundexJoin

transformations.name: soundexBranch
transformations.script:
FuzzyMatch select(mapColumn(
		acctnum,
		fullname,
		phone,
		zip,
		SoundexValue
	))~> soundexBranch

transformations.name: groupPhone
transformations.script:
soundexJoin aggregate(groupBy(phone,
		soundexBranch@SoundexValue),
	phonematch = sum(1),
		acctnum_agg = last(acctnum)) ~> groupPhone

transformations.name: phoneBranch
transformations.script:
soundexJoin select(mapColumn(
		soundexmatch,
		acctnum,
		fullname,
		phone,
		zip,
		SoundexValue = soundexBranch@SoundexValue
	))~> phoneBranch

transformations.name: phoneJoin
transformations.script:
groupPhone, phoneBranch join(acctnum_agg == acctnum,
	joinType:'right',
	broadcast: 'none')~> phoneJoin

transformations.name: groupZip
transformations.script:
phoneJoin aggregate(groupBy(zip,
		phoneBranch@SoundexValue),
	zipcount = sum(1),
		acctnum_agg = last(acctnum_agg)) ~> groupZip

transformations.name: zipBranch
transformations.script:
phoneJoin select(mapColumn(
		phonematch,
		soundexmatch,
		acctnum,
		fullname,
		phone = phoneBranch@phone,
		zip,
		SoundexValue = phoneBranch@SoundexValue
	))~> zipBranch

transformations.name: zipJoin
transformations.script:
groupZip, zipBranch join(acctnum_agg == acctnum,
	joinType:'right',
	broadcast: 'none')~> zipJoin

transformations.name: setConstants
transformations.script:
zipJoin derive(soundexweight = 50,
		zipweight = 25,
		phoneweight = 25,
		soundexbool = iif (soundexmatch > 1, 1, 0),
		zipbool = iif (zipcount > 1, 1, 0),
		phonebool = iif (phonematch > 1, 1, 0)) ~> setConstants

transformations.name: finalResult
transformations.script:
matchScore select(mapColumn(
		phone,
		acctnum,
		fullname,
		zip = zipBranch@zip,
		matchscore
	))~> finalResult

transformations.name: MapNames
CheckForDupes
transformations.script:
finalResult split(matchscore > 50,
	disjoint: false) ~> CheckForDupes@(Duplicates, NotDupe)
